intro: Luma angustior, commonly known as the narrow-leaf luma, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
